ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritrix is snoozing all the time
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi there, Yeah, that happens a lot. Several possibilities as to what to do: 1. You remembered to checkpoint, and its a good checkpoint. Stop the job, stop

Hi there,
Yeah, that happens a lot.
Several possibilities as to what to do:
1. You remembered to checkpoint, and its a good checkpoint.
Stop the job, stop heritrix, restart, restore the job, and try some more.
Might work, might fall down again.  I've seen both.

2. Decide you are done for now, and have enough data.
I've done that, too.  That is much easier.

When it stops itself, usually its been out of memory, sort of.
Did you look at the memory used display, and note you were
at max?  Resume mostly works, until it hits a certain class
of url, usually one with some complexity to parse, and it
falls down again.

Kaisa Kaunonen wrote:

> Hello all,
> I've been crawling for some time and have now over 7 million files.
> No problems, although lately Heritrix used to stop itself and I
> clicked it from 'paused' to 'running' state in mornings.
>
> A couple of days ago the crawl sank into coma. It's officially
> 'running' but all active queues have been snoozing for two days and
> should wake in three days.
>
> I'm using Heritrix version 1.10.1 with Linux (CentOS release 4.4)
> Below are some statistics.
>

> Already included size: 13620442
> pending: 0
>

> Exhausted queues: 29191
